column4: I used a live CD to edit my partition table, now when I am trying to boot grub gives me an error 15
how can I fix the partition table to reflect the changes?
because grub is still looking for the /boot in the same place it used to be... its not there anymore
how can I fix this?
i suggest you start reading the existing grub conversations
it depends on where your partitions are at now.    try the grub docs
but what file do I edit to add in the new changes
try 'grub'
and man grub
you might have to edit that too
http://rafb.net/p/AczcUI99.html
not found
http://rafb.net/p/AczcUl99.html
you have two Linux partitions - which one contains /boot ?
I'm not sure
that'd be the first step - figure out where your linux is
look at the thing u sent me - it says its windows on hda2
which is weird, I don't have windows installed
mount /dev/hda6 /mnt
mount (device) (destination)     also i suggest a linux beginner guide
I'm familiar with Linux commands
try mounting hda7
you are familiar with linux - find your partition that contains your operating system and /boot - then get back to me
